Class CustomerOrder

java.lang.Object
  CustomerOrder

public class CustomerOrder
extends java.lang.Object

Class Name: CustomerOrder
Class Purpose: This class will keep track of information related to a customer order. It will also provide the ability to process the order by totaling the item purchase, calculating discounts, tax, shipping and the total order amount. It also provides the ability to get customthe final order details in the form of a bill formatted for display.

Date created: 10-24-11 Date last modified: 10-24-11

Method Name: CustomerOrder
Method Purpose: Constructor that accepts values for all class attributes except the customer number which will be created. Initializes all class attributes to values passed in through the parameter list
Date created: 10-24-11
Date last modified: 10-24-11
Notes of specifications, special algorithms, and assumptions: initializes the class attributes by calling the set methods instead of assigning values directly.

Parameters:
name - String, the customer's name
phone - String, the customer's phone number
gadgets - int, the number of gadgets ordered
widgets - int, the number of widgets ordered
discount - int, the discount code (0, 1 or 2)
tax - char, the taxcode indicating taxable or non-taxable (N,T)
shipping - char, the shipping code indicating shipping type (O,P,S)

public void setDiscountCode(int discount)
Method Name: setDiscountCode
Method Purpose: Setter to store the discount code passed in through the parameter list in the appropriate class attribute
Date created: 10-24-11
Date last modified: 10-24-11
Notes of specifications, special algorithms, and assumptions: - discount codes are: 0 - no discount to be applied 1 - loyalty discount 2 - employee discount - if an invalid discount code is passed in, the discount code is set to 0

Parameters:
discount - int, the discount code (0,1 or 2)

Method Name: setTaxCode
Method Purpose: Setter to store the tax code passed in through the parameter list in the appropriate class attribute
Date created: 10-24-11
Date last modified: 10-24-11
Notes of specifications, special algorithms, and assumptions: - tax codes are: N or n - non-taxable T or t - taxable - if an invalid tax code is passed in, the tax code is set to Taxable

Parameters:
tax - char, the tax code (N or T)

setShippingCode

Method Name: setShippingCode
Method Purpose: Setter to store the shipping code passed in through the parameter list in the appropriate class attribute
Date created: 10-24-11
Date last modified: 10-24-11
Notes of specifications, special algorithms, and assumptions: - shipping codes are: O or o - overnight shipping P or p - priority shipping S or s - standard shipping - if an invalid shipping code is passed in, the shipping code is set to S for standard shipping

Parameters:
shipping - char, the shipping code (O,P or S)

calcItemTotal

public double calcItemTotal()
Method Name: calcItemTotal
Method Purpose: Calculates the total amount for the items purchased, not including tax shipping or discounts.
Date created: 10-24-11
Date last modified: 10-24-11
Notes of specifications, special algorithms, and assumptions: -calculate the item total by adding the total gadget cost (number of gadgets ordered * the cost of a gadget) to the total widget cost (number of widgets ordered * the cost of a widget)

Returns:
double - the total cost of items purchased (not including tax, shipping or discounts)

calcTotalDue

public double calcTotalDue()
Method Name: calcTotalDue
Method Purpose: Calculates the total amount due for the items purchased, including tax, shipping and discount.
Date created: 10-24-11
Date last modified: 10-24-11
Notes of specifications, special algorithms, and assumptions: - calculate the total cost by adding the total gadget cost to the total widget cost plus tax and shipping minus the discount.

Returns:
double - the total cost of items purchased (including tax, shipping, and discount)

calcShipping

public double calcShipping()
Method Name: calcShipping
Method Purpose: Calculates the shipping amount based on the shipping option selected.
Date created: 10-24-11
Date last modified: 10-24-11
Notes of specifications, special algorithms, and assumptions: - returns the appropriate amount of shipping based on whether it is overnight, priority or standard.

Returns:
double - the cost of shipping for the selected shipping option

calcTax

public double calcTax()
Method Name: calcTax
Method Purpose: Calculates the tax amount based on the tax option selected.
Date created: 10-24-11
Date last modified: 10-24-11
Notes of specifications, special algorithms, and assumptions: - returns the appropriate amount of tax based on whether it is taxable or non-taxable.

Returns:
double - the cost of tax for the selected tax option

calcDiscount

public double calcDiscount()
Method Name: calcDiscount
Method Purpose: Calculates the amount of discount based on the discount code selected.
Date created: 10-24-11
Date last modified: 10-24-11
Notes of specifications, special algorithms, and assumptions: - returns the appropriate amount of discount based on whether it is no discount, loyalty or employee discount.

Returns:
double - the amount of discount for the selected discount code

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Method Name: toString
Method Purpose: Returns the entire order formatted for output.
Date created: 10-24-11
Date last modified: 10-24-11
Notes of specifications, special algorithms, and assumptions: - returns the entire order formatted for output with currency displayed to two decimal places.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
String - the details of the order formatted for display
